competitors.name: Adidas
competitors.market_position: Nike’s biggest competitor globally and in China; experienced declining year-on-year growth in China alongside Nike but remains a major international brand.

competitors.name: Anta
competitors.market_position: Chinese local brand posing a significant threat to Nike's market share in China; benefited from the “Guochao” trend and expanding globally.

competitors.name: Li-Ning
competitors.market_position: Another strong Chinese local competitor gaining market share in China against Nike; capitalizing on nationalistic trends and growing rapidly.

competitors.name: Salomon
competitors.market_position: Chinese-owned brand mentioned alongside Anta and Li-Ning as part of the growing local competitors in China.

competitors.name: Asics
competitors.market_position: International sportswear brand competing with Nike in athletic shoes, noted as a competitor but less emphasized than Adidas.

competitors.name: Puma
competitors.market_position: Global sportswear brand competing in similar categories as Nike, recognized as a competitor in footwear and apparel.

competitors.name: Under Armour
competitors.market_position: Athletic brand competing with Nike, particularly in footwear and apparel segments.

competitors.name: Fila
competitors.market_position: Competes in sportswear and sneaker markets, included among Nike’s competitors.

competitors.name: New Balance
competitors.market_position: Sportswear and footwear brand competing with Nike in sneakers and related apparel.

competitors.name: Skechers
competitors.market_position: Competitor in the sneaker market, focusing more on casual and comfort shoes, included as a competitor.

competitors.name: Lululemon
competitors.market_position: Competes with Nike mostly in athletic apparel rather than footwear; premium positioning in athleisure.

competitors.name: Athleta
competitors.market_position: Athletic apparel brand (part of Gap Inc.) competing with Nike in women's sportswear.

competitors.name: VF Corporation
competitors.market_position: Parent company of multiple apparel brands competing in athletic and casual wear; recognized as a competitor in apparel space.
